Class ArgumentRequester

java.lang.Object
org.javaLab5.inputManager.ArgumentRequester
public class ArgumentRequester extends Object
The ArgumentRequester class provides utility methods to request input of different data types (e.g., Double, Float, String, Long) from the user via the console. Each method includes validation functionality, which allows custom validation rules to be applied to the input.

The input is requested in a loop, and the user is repeatedly prompted until valid input is provided or until a valid input is empty (depending on the validation logic).

This class also provides methods to request more complex objects like Coordinates and Location by prompting the user for individual properties of these objects.

      public ArgumentRequester()

  • Method Details

    • requestDouble

      public static Double requestDouble(String requested, String exceptionString, Predicate<Double> validator)
      Requests a Double value from the user, applying a specified validator. If the input is invalid, the user will be prompted again until a valid value is provided.
      Parameters:
      requested - the prompt message to display to the user.
      exceptionString - the error message to display if the input fails validation.
      validator - a Predicate that defines the validation logic for the input.
      Returns:
      the valid Double value entered by the user, or null if the input is empty and no validation is applied.

    • requestFloat

      public static Float requestFloat(String requested, String exceptionString, Predicate<Float> validator)
      Requests a Float value from the user, applying a specified validator. If the input is invalid, the user will be prompted again until a valid value is provided.
      Parameters:
      requested - the prompt message to display to the user.
      exceptionString - the error message to display if the input fails validation.
      validator - a Predicate that defines the validation logic for the input.
      Returns:
      the valid Float value entered by the user, or null if the input is empty and no validation is applied.

    • requestString

      public static String requestString(String requested, String exceptionString, Predicate<String> validator)
      Requests a String value from the user, applying a specified validator. If the input is invalid, the user will be prompted again until a valid value is provided.
      Parameters:
      requested - the prompt message to display to the user.
      exceptionString - the error message to display if the input fails validation.
      validator - a Predicate that defines the validation logic for the input.
      Returns:
      the valid String entered by the user, or null if the input is empty and no validation is applied.

    • requestLong

      public static Long requestLong(String requested, String exceptionString, Predicate<Long> validator)
      Requests a Long value from the user, applying a specified validator. If the input is invalid, the user will be prompted again until a valid value is provided.
      Parameters:
      requested - the prompt message to display to the user.
      exceptionString - the error message to display if the input fails validation.
      validator - a Predicate that defines the validation logic for the input.
      Returns:
      the valid Long value entered by the user, or null if the input is empty and no validation is applied.

    • requestCoordinates

      public static Coordinates requestCoordinates()
      Requests a Coordinates object by prompting the user for the 'x' and 'y' coordinates.
      Returns:
      a Coordinates object containing the values entered by the user.

    • requestLocation

      public static Location requestLocation(String requested)
      Requests a Location object by prompting the user for the 'x', 'y', 'z' coordinates and 'name'.
      Parameters:
      requested - the context or description of the location being requested, to be included in the prompts.
      Returns:
      a Location object containing the values entered by the user, or null if the user does not provide valid values.
